result.execSummary:
The defendant Devontay O Perkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: w/ elements and ccs
Huber

[MK] case called at 3:05pm 
Defendant Devontay O Perkins in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " Guilty  " entered on Counts #1 and #5 ; factual basis stipulated. The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2, #3, #4.

On Count #1 the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 5 years.
On Count #5 the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 1 year.  
Conditions of these Probation terms are:  
--as to Count #1 only:  to serve 45 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on  July 1st, 2022 at  8:00pm. The Court authorizes transfer of the service of this jail term to another county jail conditional on there being no use of electronic monitoring.  Mr.Perkins  is required to report for commencement and service of jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or educational program 
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--to pay costs, fees, surcharges [clerk calculation of the total: $518 plus $443= $961, plus attorney fees] 

Days credit for time already served:  5 days
The Court requires Mr. Perkins to report to the Jefferson Probation Office by 12:00 noon on Monday. 
recess 3:22pm 
[Clerk's note:  the Dane County Jail should be removed from the mailing matrix. Mr. Perkins has been released from custody.]
Status conference on June 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm. {Moved to 3PM due to accommodations w/Dane Co Jail; counsel notified by email.}
Status conference on June 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.

case called at 10:24am 
Defendant Devontay O Perkins appears with Attorney Karl Huebner.  DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court finds the Zoom video-connection to be sight and sound sufficient.
DA Hall verifies victim rights compliance.  
Mr. Perkins waives his right to Preliminary Hearing. The Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for trial 

Arraignment: 
--Service of Information is admitted; reading is waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
--Pleas of "not guilty" are entered
In response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess 10:30am  

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on February 23rd at 10:00am,  (2) Status Conference on March 25th at 11:00am

[ma] Case called at 2:41pm[All Appearances via Zoom]
Defendant Devontay O Perkins appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody.Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa appears (PD appears for bond-purposes only).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to Counsel reviewed.

The Court tolls time limits.

The Court requires a $2500  Signature Bond with conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--no possession of any firearms
recess 2:46  pm. 

NEXT: Status of Counsel on 2/3/22 at 11:00am
